Cassandra: Tables with rows and flexible columns; optimized for time-series and logs
MongoDB: JSON-like BSON documents in collections, good for nested and flexible schemas

Cassandra: CQL (Cassandra Query Language), SQL-like for column families
MongoDB: MongoDB Query Language (MQL) with rich operators and aggregations

Cassandra: Very high write throughput, linear scalability, multi-region availability
MongoDB: Rich querying, secondary indexes, strong aggregation for analytics and dashboards

Cassandra: High-velocity, write-heavy, time-series, IoT, log ingestion, global apps
MongoDB: Applications needing flexible schema, complex queries, and real-time dashboards
